      Goleta To Finally (Tar)Get a Target
      July 17, 2018 by Sanya Kamidi

      UC Santa Barbara students have long pined for a closer Target than the one over 40 miles away in Ventura. After a long time coming, Target announced Monday that it would be opening a location in Goleta in 2019.

      The store will operate at the intersection of Hollister Avenue and Storke Road, replacing the K-Mart in Storke Plaza.

      The location is approximately two miles from the UCSB campus.

      Santa Barbara, get ready for your second @Target store! Check out our newest store coming to Goleta in 2019: https://t.co/GlbUKIOVk2. pic.twitter.com/IEvEVyfwyf

      — Target News (@TargetNews) July 16, 2018

      The store is set to be the second Target in Santa Barbara opening in 2019, with another location secured for the intersection of State Street and La Cumbre Road at 3891 State Street.

      The State Street location was announced in early January.

      Exciting news: We’re opening a new @Target store in Santa Barbara, CA, at the corner of State St. & La Cumbre Rd. in Oct. 2018. Details: https://t.co/GlbUKIOVk2 pic.twitter.com/2oX9mbA1Qh

      — Target News (@TargetNews) January 4, 2018

      The Goleta location touts an approximate 117,000 square feet and plans to offer clothing, fresh goods, home decor and health and beauty sections among several others, according to the official Target website.

      Print
      Sanya Kamidi

      Sanya Kamidi serves as the Deputy News Editor and before that was a Social Media Manager. Loves coffee and will find any excuse to miss class for the Nexus.

      She can be reached at skamidi@dailynexus.com or @skamidi on Twitter.
